Add these two things and you've got yourself 5 stars!!!!

body: I like the fonts and layout. It seems really easy for my old eyes to pick up the text. I also like that the ads seem less obtrusive but I definitely see them. One of the other sites is more like the history channel because by the time the thing loads the event is over. Also this site seems to center on the weather and not silly political opinion/indoctrination pieces. Good

As a blind use of this application it is opened the world to me through easy and accessible communication. The voice input helps me type with sighted users efficiently. I love the voice and video calling feature as well as older emoticons which express how I am feeling

The only drawback I have is that I cannot enlarge the keyboard any larger. I always use speak to text to eliminate my issue of typing on smaller keys. It would be a help for visually impaired. I will never give up the gboard keyboard because the pros most definitely outweigh this one con.

body: I am legally blind own a guide dog and live in Los Angeles. Google Maps has proven to be an invaluable resource for us to navigate around the city. Thank you so much Google Maps!!!

Though over the years continual updates have taught me never to rely on features with which I may fall in love - e.g. Latitude or when Offline Maps disappeared (now returned). body: Purchased a new phone and my Notes did not transfer. Had to screen shot .each note on old phone and email to myself and then download each one to my .gallery. I needed a note app that would allow me to to attach the .screenshot/photo to recreate my notes and luckily after trying many I came .across this app. I now have all my notes on new phone. So far I like this .app. However I only rated it 4 stars because you cannot change the font or .use bold letters. Unless I just didn't know where to change the font. I .prefer using Ariel font as it is easy for my old eyes to read. Also wish it .would allow you to adjust the shades or choose variant or combo of the .colors you can choose for the notes to further customize them. Also don't .care for it's widget (does not look like a note app) but once I get use to .using it perhaps that won't be a problem.Thank you.
bbcGuidelines: Colour and meaning, Content resizing, Adjustability

body: amazing app ive been using it for years all it is missing is a DARK MODE so people dont blind themselves with a bright white screen when checking snap late at night

Include dark mode please. You're about to blind someone with this hangout white board screen. Help us make dark mode an alternative like other apps. This is the only app in my phone without a dark mode. And it's affecting my sight when I open it. Thanks üôè

First of all I rate this one star because it never even functions on my other phone and is forced bloatware. Although it does now function on the phone I'm currently using why does it have to turn my screen bright when I open the app? I literally have a medical condition where this causes me severe pain - it's called photophobia. There is no need for such a 'feature' and it's ridiculous that it even exists not to mention especially insensitive to consumers that are like me.

I would give it 5 stars but I can't adjust the brightness of the screen. Its really annoying when I adjust the setting on my Samsung Galaxy 3 and as soon as I open to page I was reading its as bright as ever! Very annoying for someone with sensitive eyes like myself.

Up until I got my current phone I was able to put this app in dark mode. Now I can't and I don't understand why. This is the same app I have had on all previous phones yet no dark mode. Other than that the app works great. But please fix this. I don't like opening this app at night because no matter what without dark mode the screen is to bright for my sensitive eyes.
People who are sight impaired cannot read the small letters on emails. Before there was text reflow or wrapping which matched the letter size to the screen in Gmail it doesn't exist!!! Shame.

so far so good. Haven't used as much as I'd like but it's fun for catching up while loved ones are away. I wish I could make the view of myself larger on my screen so it's easier to see during conversations when you are hands free but still trying to remain in frame( I'm near sighted). I'm not sure if u can play with filters or stuff like that but my kids would enjoy it when they're checking in and I'm checking on their whereabouts üòâ.

I would like to see Instagram allow photos to enlarge in screen size. This would be considerate of people who does not see well or are near sighted and wording as well as photos need enhancement but is out of focus if U wear prescription lenses for near sightedness. Not everyone wears no line bifocals or bifocals when then need them....and seeing up close is a technical tool so please apply it to the app. There should not be a struggle to enjoy the app especially if viewing from a mobile device

I loved it. For such a price I truely do. But I started feeling motion sickness after using it for a few minutes. FPS is not that good when moving head its jittery like frame skips. But when kept the head in a single position its better. Also I had a little but negligible eye strain at the back of my eyes I dunno why. I don't wear spectacles. My phone has a 1080p screen with 400 PPI still I see the visuals pixelated.

Doesn't allow tiny font size enlargement within app or adapt to my enlarged font in the general device settings. The IoS app DOES adapt to system font settings I can not use this without eye strain & the font is ridiculous for a tablet screen anyway.

appName: Flipboard - Latest News- Top Stories & Lifestyle
body: I enjoy using this app but can only use it for a short duration each time. Why? That bright white screen is annoying and eyes start to hurt after 5 minutes. Please install a Dark Mode. Many phones own ship with screen tech that benefit from dark mode operations. Battery life is superior and user experience is enhanced. Flipboard is a wonderful concept and can replace many news apps and websites as the one and only news source. The problem is that with a glaring white background one can not use Flipboard long term without suffering eye strain. Implementation of a dark mode solves this problem and improves the user experience tenfold.
resource: BACKGROUND, MODE, WHITE, SCREEN, BRIGHT, DARK

body: I was in the middle of a graphic novel (Superman: Action Comics volume 1) when my Google Nexus 10 auto-installed the latest Kindle build. Prior to this new build graphic novels had been fun to read and even the smallest details were clear on the Nexus' excellent screen. With this latest Kindle build everything even normal sized text is blurry and causes immediate painful eye strain. Fix this Amazon and fix it fast or I won't be purchasing any more Kindle books from you. I have so far spent well over $3000 on Kindle books. Expect to lose a lot of business if this bug isn't fixed immediately.
I wish they hadn't updated it. It was better before. If there's only one note I doesn't adjust to fill the empty screen and it's a not of an eye strain.

Previous version looked better much calmer for me. Gmail Lollipop update causes too much eye strain - big red bright area on top of screen skinnier fonts. Gmail used to have more professional look before now it's a candy crush like app. Distracts from work environment annoying blinding circles. Developers should work on user adjustable interface not everyone likes oversaturated kiddie colors. Seriously Google?? Samsung Galaxy Note4 Lollipop 5.0

appName: Waze - GPS- Maps- Traffic Alerts & Live Navigation
body: Update: Was 5 stars. Not a fan of the version 4 changes. The comic animations are cute but the interface changes have me spending more time looking at the screen to do anything (instead of the road). Removing the ability to report issues on the other side of the road was foolish and cutting down color palettes from many to two neither of which are color-blind friendly was equally foolish. I like change when change is productive but this is a step backward.

I like using maps in android auto and I love the offline map feature. It's super handy when travelling overseas however I HATE the blue dot icon. I have astigmatism and my sight is often blurry making offline maps very difficult for me to use on my phone because I cant always distinguish the lighter blue direction spread around the dot. Someone else has to read the map for me! Please allow users to change the icon to an arrow or something distinctive to help use maps easier.
i am color blind and can no loger see the pastel color icons. i hate it
How about changing the message read icons so people with colour blindness could easy the changed checkmark?

Update: New UI is a steaming pile of trash that looks like it's lifted straight put of a crappy knockoff iMessenger. Please either undo this disaster or at least give us the option to go back to the old UI. Randomly crashes alot signs me out for no good reason occasionally decides to hide messages doesn't always notify me of new messages crashes alot when answering calls and is not color-blind friendly as the little status icons are hard to make out. But at least I can sometimes kind of use it to talk to my friends.

body: I understand the need to have the Prime option so the developers can be paid for their work. But one thing that should NOT be a paid-for feature is resizing the icons. I am nearly blind and without being able to make my icons larger the only way I can distinguish them is by making each one a solid unique color. Which isn't what I want. There are many free features that could be Prime instead but making it impossible to resize icons without paying is ableist and limits your userbase.

Do you know what is wrong with you people at Amazon? You act like dictators. You made the fire stick which is good. But then you never gave us a choice about anyting related to it. The original interface with it was fine. Now you've changed it again and the app icons people use are so tiny that people with eyesight problems can't see them very well. Why don't you make another fire stick and let the people that buy them change things on them if they want to.

Please stop messing with the UI. If you want to assist people with vision issues provide option in setting to increase icon and font sizes. I was comfortable seeing most of my alarms in 1 page and to read all those labels easily. The new designer thought labels are meaningless.

menu fonts are too washed out grey to see at a glance.. the icons too small. we should be able to adjust how the menu of emails looks for those of us with visual impairments and yes all my settings are on largest

An option to remove something from 'continue watching' would be nice 4. A way to check what will soon be taken off Netflix would be nice too. 5. It's difficult to find the option to give recommendations about programs Netflix should host. 6. More content on LGBT and Climate Change solutions please. A BIG PAIN: switching between apps and returning to Netflix leaves the screen without the playing drawer. The app has to be closed and started again.

All sorts of other apps even Google apps offer a dark option. (Heck even Apple recently 'invented' a dark mode in their latest OS.) Please release an option to switch to a dark theme.

body: I've been using Waze for Postmates and similar delivery apps for a while now. It's definitely fast and having other users warn about police officers traffic and gas prices is very helpful. I also am not personally a fan of the cute cartoony style but that's just me.

While the abilities to add an image to a text post or change the font thereof are appreciated there are still a number of functionality and useability issues that have yet to be resolved and/or have arisen with this new mobile update. 1. The search function still turns up no results on my own blogs regardless of whether the search bar's content is correctly typed. This error has been present for at least three updates. 2. Please put the tabs bar back on the top of the screen - or add a function for individual users to choose whether it's on the top or the bottom of the screen. This change implemented in the previous update was not only unnecessary and pointless but also unexpected thereby causing many users (myself included) to experience mental distress. Your userbase is made up of an overwhelmingly large number of people with mental illnesses. These mental illnesses can sometimes be caused to flare when the person is exposed to a sudden and unexpected change. 3. The new blue bubble around tags being typed is distracting at best and a major accessibility issue at worst. For those with vision problems the blue bubble may make it impossible to proofread the text within regardless of the color of said text. 4. The fact that tags being typed may be cut off by an ellipsis makes proofreading difficult even for those with healthy eyesight and even more so for those with memory issues (such as myself and several of my friends who also use this app). 5. The clickable area for adding tags to a post is now smaller. This makes tagging less accessible to those with vision problems and/or poor fine-motor control. The previous interface which provided a long bar as the clickable area was much more accessible. 6. It now takes more steps to create tag and choose the posting time of both new posts and reblogs. The previous interface was much more efficient and user-friendly. 7. While the new ability to read every tag on a post without scrolling is appreciated the 'See All' command often does not show all proceeding tags. It often cuts out proceeding tags that are shorter than three words each. 8. This final note is more of a personal preference but the personal preferences of your userbase are still things you should take into consideration when formulating an update. A return of the full-page list of a user's blogs/sideblogs from which said user could access any of their blogs or blogs' settings they needed to would be highly appreciated. Thank you for your time.

body: I have tried dozens of launchers in search of one that has icons and text that can be scaled up making it accessible to those who are visually impaired and that also includes notification badges on the screen for missed IM's. I have found that all that provide the ability to enlarge icons and text require payment for this feature. I believe this is an effort to take advantage of the visually impaired community. Therefore every launcher that I have tried that has the ability to enlarge icons but only if you are willing to pay extra for this feature will be receiving only one star from me and I have tried most every launcher in the PlayStore. I will go through each and every one that I have tried that has this feature available but only if you are willing to pay extra for it and they will be receiving only one star for lack of accessibility and what I believe is a bias towards the visually impaired community and an attempt to profiteer

body: please give users the option to flip or scroll it makes it very hard on some older viewers i have vision problems and between flip and the animations i start having eye strain within minutes one other small problem embedded videos on most pages wont go fullscreen making them harder to watch that Aside your app is a wonderful source of news and stories and i would recommend it to all my friends if i had not already

I think it's okay. The latest update is super annoying though. There's no option for dark mode and I have super sensitive eyes so sometimes I'll have to turn my brightness all the way down just to make it bearable. Also please get rid of those annoying videos. This isn't TikTok. Lastly I really miss the feature where you can click on your groups at the top. Made it wayyyy easier to find new ideas. I am very pleased with the Netflix app with the exception of two things: (1) While viewing a movie on my Samsung Galaxy Proclaim the lights for the four buttons at the bottom of the phone (menu home back and search) do not turn off. This makes for a major eye strain while trying to enjoy the video. (2) If I pause the video to check a new notification that came through on my phone I have to click 'Resume' and reload the video when I switch back to Netflix. I'd rather it stayed loaded and I could simply press play to resume. That being said I truly treasure this app especially when I am stuck waiting somewhere like in the car while a family member goes into a store or when I'm in line and while I'm in bed and not quite ready to fall asleep. Thanks Netflix!
Previous app was simple and clean. This app is cluttered with borders and even after turning off autoplay still has dancing bars in the corner of the pictures. A nightmare for anyone with low vision.

On the phone I have to infinitely scroll down to see the news. There is no option to turn the picture off for example so I can have an overview of the news items. The background changed from black to white when reading news and although it might be a personal preference white background is more eye straining and wasting battery power on some devices. I think at least a 'night mode' is needed. Font size is also a problem - it is best to be able to adjust the font size.

appName: Life360: Family Locator & GPS Tracker for Safety
body: As a severely visually impaired user this app was used several times a day by me to 'check in' that I had arrived to my places of work etc. Now that the one touch 'check in' feature has been removed and colour scheme changed it is impossible for me to use. Also drains battery and constantly says not connected even when using wifi or full 3G/4G which leaves me in further danger of not being able to contact my family. This app used to be the most used on my phone. Now I no longer trust it. UNINSTALLING!

It gets worse every update. I don't want snapchat. I don't want to react to every message. I don't want to set a reminder whenever I use the word May. I don't want to post my picture to my day. Furthermore please add the ability to increase the text size. It's too small for me! It's been over a year and still nothing. Also with the new colour feature you sometimes have white text on a light blue background. Hard to read! This app is not friendly to the visually impaired.

Biggest issue with this app is the tiny fraction of the screen devoted to the message I am in the process of typing the rest of the screen is wasted on displaying messages I've already read. This app is extremely difficult if not impossible to scroll through a multi-lined message for that purpose. 3. I know I can disable notifications manually but that's inconvenient.

I would probably do more with Alexa if I had a written list of voice commands preferably in related groups rather than just alphabetical. Alexa is useful for anyone with sight problems or arthritis in their hands but for older people the use of apps is far from 'intuitive ' and the 'getting started' leaflet was extremely brief. We have had problems using Alexa with Sonos probably due to the frequent Sonos updates. I am using Alexa for a few specific tasks. I can't get TV info.

Ok...when the app first updated with the new revamp I couldn't use it because it kept stopping. Idk why but I solved that problem by simply reinstalling it. And before I did that .. I went through here reading a bunch of the latest reviews which most all of them were not good. A lot of people are disappointed in the new design and complaining about it and after reading all that... I thought it was going to be so awful and this huge mess of an app that was really complicated and have a blinding white light as people had described..etc...Then when I finally logged into it to check it out for myself... I was pleasantly surprised actually! It wasn't that bad at all! It's not that much different! I was thinking...what are all these people complaining about this so much for? Because you have to tap on the things now to open them? Big whoop! Everyone is entitled to their own likes and opinions of course and I don't mean any disrespect to anyone here but There's nothing wrong with this app! The old version was great too. It didn't need to be changed but everyone is being a little ridiculous and over dramatic about this one! It's not that hard to navigate through at all in my opinion! And if the light is too bright for those with more sensitive eyes then why don't you try turning down the light on your phones then? I certainly wouldn't oppose to maybe adding some different color schemes though and maybe allow users to choose their own color preferences?

The app started off great but recently they've been changing the look and feel of the app for example they had an option to read the books with a black background which helps with my vision issues making it easier on my eyes to read but they changed that so now it's a weird grey color. They added an offline reading option which is cool but now if you were reading a book and close the app you have to scroll through all the books saved in offline to try and find your recent reads.

I love Skype. It is the only way I have to communicate with some of my friends. However this new update added a bunch of irrelevant stuff that was more annoying than anything else. (Seriously I liked the old color scheme. I'm color blind and have a lot of trouble seeing the words against some of the color options that my friends have.) My biggest issue is that on my Samsung Galaxy S8 my enter key stopped working on Skype with this new update. As I'm sure you can tell I use my enter key a lot and since I also use skype mobile for some work stuff as well I'm sure you can understand my issue with not being able to break up my paragraphs. My partner has a Samsung Galaxy S6 and is now having the same issue with the enter key on this update. Please fix this and I will raise this back to five stars.

I expected more from CNN. The app is missing a basic accessibility feature namely the ability for a visually impaired person to either pinch and zoom or tap on images to make them larger. Also everytime a news article is loaded it reloads two additional times. So as a person is partway through reading an article it reloads and you have to find your place again. This happens a second time which adds to the frustration. It's kind of like someone slapping a newspaper out of your hand as your reading it. Finally some articles have a video which leads a person to believe the video will be about that particular article. Instead clicking on such videos just starts the live CNN feed so you don't get to watch what you were interested in unless it happens to be playing on the live feed when you click on it. All of this combined with slow load times (even on 4G LTE) is enough for me to switch to another news app.

body: I am a totally blind user and I use my phone and tablet with Android's built in TalkBack screenreading software to navigate my devices and read what's on the screen. My understanding before installing Facebook Lite was that it would work with TalkBack. I was quite frankly disgusted to discover that the app is completely unuseable with TalkBack or other screenreading software for the blind. With Facebook having a dedicated accessibility team there is no excuse whatsoever for this to be the case especially given the fact that both Facebook and Messenger as well as the Messenger Lite app are TalkBack compatible. So why shouldn't Facebook lite be? When I open the app for the first time I was greeted by an unlabelled image that TalkBack won't read again making it completely unuseable. Great if it uses less data/storage but alas tough luck for TalkBack users. Facebook I'm very disappointed I would have expected better from you guys. Please make this TalkBack friendly!

body: There's no acknowledgement sound anymore which means you're not sure if it picked up your 'OK Google'. On top of that for the past year or so it hasn't been nearly as responsive or clever as it used to be. It's quite common to press the microphone button see it listening I ask a question and it continues listening with nothing being said. This happens despite retraining my voice. Siri has gone downhill this past year as well. I really thought that voice command technology would be an ongoing hit especially on smart watches. For blind people it's essential. Now it looks as though the technology is in decline with little to no support. It's such a shame. Update - Cortana seems to be the best at the moment. It reminds me of an old Google Voice (when it worked).

appName: Swiggy : Food Delivery | Instamart Grocery | Genie
body: After I posted a review of the app here I got a great response from the Swiggy team. It is so heartening to read the 'Whats's New' section of the latest update. It is great that the Swiggy team acknowledged the accessibility issues with the app and then set out to correct the same. That effort is to be greatly appreciated. After the most recent update it is now possible for a TalkBack user to order food on Swiggy. Not like the old way but using the Actions option from the TalkBack menu after focusing on a particular item. The entire menu will still not be available but on doubletapping the 'Recommended Item the next category will become available tapping on that will present the next and so on. Not ideal but functional. The positive approach of the Swiggy team indicates that they will take seriously the issue with the menu option not being TalkBack accessible even now. The menu option at the bottom of the screen is not even recognized by TalkBack. Hope with the next update they will get that sorted. The effort and commitment of the team deserves 5 stars. The end product is not quite there. So only a 4 star overall at this point.
Includes TalkBack Accessibility Menu and more.

body: I've been using Twitter for Android since last year and I'm glad to see that for the most part the app is very accessible with the TalkBack screenreader for blind and visually impaired users like myself. I have noticed however that there are a couple of bugs which need to be addressed and squashed. Firstly when reading direct messages (especially longer DM's) TalkBack doesn't read the message in its entirety. Instead it reads a couple of sentences or lines after which it refreshes and reads again from the beginning of said message. In some cases the TalkBack focus moves to an earlier or later message as it is reading a specific one within that specific conversation window. Also in the Home tab TalkBack doesn't focus on the first tweet on my timeline and I have to scroll all the way up until I find it. I'm very disappointed to see that these two issues have not been fixed in the latest update! Please fix!

appName: OfficeSuite - Word docs- Excel sheets- PDF files
body: I am a totally blind user and I use TalkBack Android's integrated screenreading software to read what is on the screen. I was surprised and dismayed to discover that OfficeSuite is not at all compatible with the TalkBack screenreader surprised given the fact that other apps from the same developers are completely TalkBack friendly. In OfficeSuite TalkBack will not read any document of any filetype making it impossible for me to read navigate through or edit documents. Also there are a lot of unlabelled buttons which TalkBack cannot identify thus it is impossible to know what said buttons do. Please make the app more TalkBack compatible and I will adjust my rating accordingly.

body: I ha ve been using the Ola app for some time now. Had mailed a feedback earlier on mail but it bounced. I find the app largely useful however there are a couple of major issues that need to be fixed. First in Delhi at least I have observed that you won't get a cab after 9 30 at night very often. Same is the case during early morning too. Then during day time the peak rate gets far too high so unless there are worthwhile offers I look at other apps Uber has a lot more cabs at night...... The 2nd is an accessibility related issue. I am a blind person using my phone with Google's TalkBack screen reader. The Ola app is largely accessible but the driver rating section is not at all accessible. The different ratings are not read out by TalkBack one has to do a random tap and hope for the best. Hopefully these issues will be fixed pretty soon.

body: Good app but some books don't scroll in single page mode. Mostly good the single pane mode for graphic novels works well but some books just don't work in single page mode and I'm partially sighted. You don't find out which ones until you've bought them which is very annoying.
Word runner is a cool featurebut pls add a sliding mode like in news channels. That reduces the eye strain even better.
Every thing is good but if you add a widget of WhatsApp direct call and direct video call on the homescreen for low vision people like Duo app . Thank you!

I really like the app. Much better than the IOS version. But I do have some suggestions to make it better: 1. (Playback with screen off) In older versions you could play videos with the screen off. This is very nice for when my friends who are blind want to use my phone to 'watch' to videos. Turning off the screen was great so I could save battery.

As a Wattpad user for over five years I can fully say it used to be the .best a for reading writing and reviewing books: key phrase being used to .be. Running Issues: 1) TOO MANY ADS- I fully support Wattpad having ads in .order to support the creators of this app but having to watch a 30s video .every other chapter is ridiculous. 2) POOR PUBLISHING- This one they seemed .to have fixed but it can still be a problem. Sometimes a user can publish .a story but it doesn't actually publish it or it doesn't show everything .the author wrote to the author. (i.e. the author writes some then comes .back and writes more later. The stuff written later won't show to the .author in the published chapter in reader mode but it will show for other .readers.) Also chapters often have ‚Äúrevision issues‚Äù not allowing it to be .published. Sometimes I have this issue 4-5 times to publish a chapter .other times it's not a problem. 3) MESSAGE BOARD- Message board (where one .can pm others) is often down and doesn't send messages through always and .it doesn't always update if new messages are received. 4) POOR CUSTOMER .SERVICE- Wattpad help is where you can message a bot and then message the .support team if there is an issue however the bots are next to useless. .With limited dialogue they can understand they often just pick out words .they know and decide what you clearly should be asking. As for messaging .support It only appears as on the actual site not app and I have tried .this only to find no message actually goes through. Overall I rate 3 stars .only because I loved it so much-it really deserves one or maybe two. It has .become a disappointment. All four of these issues have exist for at least 6 .months and have not been fixed in any updates. I was tempted to upgrade to .Wattpad premium but I'm not willing to pay money for a glitchy app with no .customer service.

Apart from the annoying unskipable ads now i have to manually change the video quality of every video. This is very irritating. Even in the settings when i have set it to 'high picture quality' every video's quality is 480 max so I have to change picture quality of EACH video separately. With a person with visual disability this becomes very difficult. Please revert this unnecessary change to how it was before. Would be nice if premium version were available for purcahse in Pakistan as well.

This app is truly atrocious for screen reader accessibility. The app is .completely unusable with Talkback and if the goal of this app is to bring .Facebook to people in other countries with lower-end devices some of these .people are going to need accessibility and this app out early fails
I like this app except for one major bug. When reading direct messages TalkBack zooms back to the top of the conversation midway through reading a message.

appName: Swiggy : Food Delivery | Instamart Grocery | Genie
body: Swiggy is the best app. Small suggestion from my side. The application is very much accessible for visually impaired. But I would love to see some more accessibility Improvements. Stop the animation and make swiggy instamart more accessible.
The app is not accessible for those with low vision. For example I cannot hide the ads so I can see the map or request a ride. So I have to use it on a different platform

This application is terrible if you are blind and use TalkBack as a screen reader. While I was able to create an account I wasn't even able to make a blog post. Numerous buttons are not labeled with text so that TalkBack can read them and double tapping on the text box for posting does not activate it. I used to have an iPhone and Tumblr is inaccessible on iOS with Voice Over as well. Tumblr really needs to listen to blind users of its app and make the necessary fixes requisite for complete functionality
